'Zack Polanski effect' has UK Greens closing gap on Labour
subhead: The unconventional profile of the new leader of Britain's Green Party, who embraces 'eco-populism' and has made social justice a central focus, has allowed his historically marginal party to claim the political space to the left of Labour.

Bondi Beach mass shooting appears driven by 'Islamic State ideology,' says Australian PM
'China uses major climate forums to do business and expand its influence'
subhead: The West condemns Beijing's social and environmental model, yet continues to benefit from it. Its blind dependence on Chinese 'green' technologies is the result of this hypocritical approach, researcher Isabelle Feng argues.

title: Rob Reiner, 'Spinal Tap' and 'When Harry Met Sally' director, has died
subhead: The 78-year-old filmmaker and his 68-year-old wife were found stabbed to death in their Los Angeles home on Sunday, December 14.

title: 'The New Yorker's 100th anniversary': A certain type of journalism, as narrated by Julianne Moore
subhead: Marshall Curry's documentary takes viewers behind the scenes of the iconic American weekly magazine, which continues to thrive in the modern era.

title: Sexual assault reports draw scrutiny to France's after-school sector
subhead: For several months, reports of sexual assaults on children outside regular school hours have multiplied in Paris and across France. This phenomenon remains difficult to quantify and define, affecting a sector that is poorly regulated and lacks clear boundaries.
byline: Eléa Pommiers and  Lorraine de Foucher

Chile's presidential election confirms South America's far-right turn
subhead: José Antonio Kast, the president-elect, has pledged to tackle insecurity, irregular immigration and economic hardship, while avoiding references to the dictatorship and his ultraconservative views on social issues.

title: War in Ukraine: 'The EU has too few cards to hesitate over playing the financial one'
subhead: The 27 member states must soon decide the fate of €210 billion in assets belonging to Moscow. Marginalized in peace negotiations, the European Union now has the chance to assert its influence in resolving the conflict, argues Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: Trump's FBI purge: 'We are not trending toward an authoritarian force. We are at one'
subhead: Since returning to power, Donald Trump has relentlessly sought to reshape the federal law enforcement agency. In his eyes, it is guilty of investigating him and people close to him. He has set out to bring it to heel by firing dozens of agents.
